intro: Anisodus luridus var. fischerianus, commonly known as the Fischer's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
